facts.text: Nashville Soccer Club joined Major League Soccer (MLS) as an expansion team after spending two seasons in the USL Championship.
Geodis Park, the home of Nashville Soccer Club, is the largest soccer-specific stadium in the United States.
John Ingram, owner of Ingram Industries, is the principal owner of Nashville Soccer Club.
Nashville FC, a team founded by a supporters group with inspiration from F.C. United of Manchester, merged with another group in February 2014 for the NPSL season.
Nashville SC was founded in 2016 when the USL awarded a franchise to its founding ownership group.
Nashville FC sold its team name, logo, and color scheme to the new USL franchise Nashville SC in exchange for a 1 percent equity stake and a voting seat on its board.
Gary Smith, a former 2010 MLS Cup winning coach, was announced as Nashville SC's first manager in April 2017.
The formal bid to add an MLS franchise to Nashville began in January 2017, with John Ingram buying a majority stake in DMD Soccer on March 4, 2017.
Nashville was named one of ten finalist cities for four MLS franchises as part of its bid to join MLS.
MLS officially awarded an expansion team to Nashville on December 20, 2017.
Nashville SC joined the MLS in the 2020 season.
Mike Jacobs was announced as Nashville SC's first general manager.
Ian Ayre was announced as Nashville SC's first CEO.
Nashville SC played their first game on February 10, 2018, against Atlanta United FC.
Nashville SC's inaugural MLS match was on February 29, 2020, against Atlanta United FC.
Walker Zimmerman scored Nashville SC's first MLS goal.
The attendance for Nashville SC's inaugural MLS match was 59,069, the highest attended soccer event in Tennessee as of that date.
Nashville SC was unable to participate in the "MLS is Back Tournament" due to multiple COVID-19 cases on the team.
Nashville SC finished the 2020 regular MLS season with a record of 8–8–7.
Hany Mukhtar won both the Landon Donovan MVP and Golden Boot awards in 2022.
Nashville SC's primary colors are electric gold and acoustic blue.
The club's crest features a gold octagon with a monogram "N" and several vertical bars in blue to represent sound waves and vibrations.
The Roadies is the original organized supporter group of Nashville SC, established in February 2014.
Geodis Park is the largest soccer-specific stadium in the United States with a seating capacity of 30,000.
The Nashville Metro Council approved the funding for Geodis Park with a vote of 31-yes and 8-no on September 4, 2018.
The original funding plan for Geodis Park was amended on February 13, 2020, to make the stadium 100 percent privately funded.
Nashville SC played at First Tennessee Park during the USL era before moving to Nissan Stadium for their first two seasons in MLS.
Nashville SC was a runner-up in the Leagues Cup in 2023.
Nashville SC was granted an MLS franchise in 2017.
Nashville SC switched from the Western Conference to the Eastern Conference in 2020 after playing 2 matches.
Lionel Messi, Sergio Busquets, and Luis Suarez, all former Barcelona teammates, played together for Inter Miami against Nashville SC as reported on April 20, 2024.
Nashville SC signed four players from a USL Championship side on November 22, 2019.

The Nashville MLS expansion team unveiled its name and crest on February 20, 2019, with Mark, Zygi, and Leonard Wilf (Minnesota Vikings owners) and the Turner Family (managing partners of Nashville-based MarketStreet Enterprises) being partners in the soccer club.
Filip Forsberg and Giannis Antetokounmpo joined the Nashville Soccer Club ownership group as reported on a date prior to March 2, 2023.
Nashville FC, a fan-owned soccer club, was under threat from US franchise systems as of February 25, 2015.
Nashville Atlas FC joined the National Premier Soccer League (NPSL) as reported on February 10, 2014.
Nashville FC had its first home opener on May 27, 2014, drawing a significant crowd and eyeing Greer Stadium for future matches.
The USL formally welcomed Nashville to the league on July 1, 2016.
A bill to help fund a Nashville MLS stadium was proposed by the Tennessee legislature on December 19, 2016.
Gary Smith, an MLS Cup-winning coach, was announced as the head coach for Nashville SC on April 12, 2017.
Nashville's bid for an MLS expansion team received a boost with the approval of a $275 million stadium proposal on November 8, 2017.
John Ingram bought a majority stake in Nashville SC on May 4, 2017, aligning efforts for the MLS bid.
The Nashville SC moved from Nissan Stadium to Geodis Park in 2022.
Nashville SC hosted the 2023 Leagues Cup final.
Tampa Bay Mutiny, Miami Fusion, and Chivas USA are all former MLS teams, with operational years from 1996–2001, 1998–2001, and 2005–2014, respectively.
Nashville SC's top goalscorer in their 2018 USL season was Brandon Allen with 9 goals.
In the 2019 USL Championship season, Daniel Ríos was Nashville SC's top goalscorer with 21 goals.
Hany Mukhtar was Nashville SC's top goalscorer in both the 2020 and 2021 MLS seasons, with 5 and 19 goals respectively.
Nashville SC's first season in MLS was in 2020, where they finished 7th in the Eastern Conference and 14th overall.
Nashville SC's average attendance increased from 12,925 in their inaugural MLS season in 2020 to 19,338 in 2021.
In 2022, Hany Mukhtar was the top scorer with 26 goals.
In 2023, Hany Mukhtar was the top scorer with 17 goals.
In 2024, Sam Surridge was the top scorer with 12 goals.
As of 2024, Hany Mukhtar has scored a total of 66 goals.
Alex Muyl has made the most appearances with 194 as of 2024.
In the 2023 MLS season, the team finished 7th in the Eastern Conference and 12th overall.
The team's highest attendance was 28,599 in 2024.
The team was the runner-up in the Leagues Cup in 2023.
Hany Mukhtar has the highest goal-scoring ratio with 0.45 goals per game as of 2024.
Sam Surridge has a goal-scoring ratio of 0.55 goals per game as of 2024.
